info.author: R. Tyler Ballance
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU Library or Lesser General Public License (LGPL)
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
PyECC is a Python module wrapped around the ``libseccure`` library which itself 
is 
based off of code developed originally for the `seccure(1) utility <http://
point-at-infinity.org/seccure/>`_.

Build and Install
-----------------

Since PyECC uses `setuptools <http://pypi.python.org/pypi/setuptools>`_ to 
build and 
install the PyECC module and corresponding library, you need to run:: 
    
    % sudo python setup.py install


Author(s)
---------

PyECC was developed by R. Tyler Ballance (``tyler@slide.com``) at `Slide, Inc. 
<http://slide.com>`_. 
The original seccure(1) binary however was developed by B. Poettering.
info.name: PyECC
info.summary: PyECC is a simple Python module for performing Elliptical Curve Cryptography
info.html_description:
PyECC is a Python module wrapped around the libseccure library which itself is based off of code developed originally for the seccure(1) utility.

Build and Install

Since PyECC uses setuptools to build and install the PyECC module and corresponding library, you need to run:

% sudo python setup.py install

Author(s)

PyECC was developed by R. Tyler Ballance (tyler@slide.com) at Slide, Inc.. The original seccure(1) binary however was developed by B. Poettering.
